author: nhcwebmaster@noaa.gov (NHC Webmaster)
nhc_headline: ...BERYL EXPECTED TO MAKE LANDFALL ALONG MIDDLE TEXAS COAST  WITHIN THE NEXT HOUR OR TWO... ...300 AM CDT POSITION UPDATE...
summary:
...BERYL EXPECTED TO MAKE LANDFALL ALONG MIDDLE TEXAS COAST  WITHIN THE NEXT HOUR OR TWO... ...300 AM CDT POSITION UPDATE...
 As of 3:00 AM CDT Mon Jul 8
 the center of Beryl was located near 28.4, -96.0
 with movement NNW at 10 mph.
 The minimum central pressure was 982 mb
 with maximum sustained winds of about 80 mph.

title: Summary - Hurricane Beryl (AT2/AL022024)
